Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install (2+)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Wierl

defendant.name: Wierl, Cody J
defendant.address: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Curtis Julka.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Julka - defendant will plea to OWI - 3rd offense with no repeater and 2015CF68 & 2015CF80 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 striking the repeater and orders 2015CF68 and 2015CF80 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Julka.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-45 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.
-$600 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 2 years.
-IID - 2 years.
-AODA

Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files the informations with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the informations and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets all cases for preliminary hearing on November 17, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Status hearing at 08-25-2015 09:15 am

1:50 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count/case.  Court finds probable cause on 2015CT59.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on 2015CT59.  Court sets bond at 2015CT59 - $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription..  2015CF68 - $500.00 signature bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set both cases for Status Hearing on August 25, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:56 p.m.
